Key Match Events: The benches of the New York Yankees and Kansas City Royals cleared after a slide into 2nd base in the 6th inning of Game 4 of the American League Division Series, with no punches thrown.
Pre-Game Insights: There was much talk about the open hostility between the two teams during a somewhat epic rivalry from 1976 through ‘80.
Post-Match Reflections: Kansas City manager Matt Quatraro said, 'Yeah, Volpe had the ball, blocked the bag, Maikel probably didn't care for that too much, and it got a little chippy.'

Yankees manager Aaron Boone compared the incident to old clips from the late ‘70s, saying 'it was like, if there was some kind of upset over the slide or whatever, we should just go back and show a little Hal McRae and Willie Randolph and we'll all laugh at ourselves.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The series was clinched by the Yankees with a 3-1 victory, and all four games were decided by two runs or less.
Others: Maikel Garcia felt Volpe was blocking his path to the base, so he aggressively slid across in an effort to carve out some space.
Garcia and Volpe had a disagreement over the slide, with Garcia saying Volpe used his other arm to tag him with the ball, while Volpe said he was just playing hard and trying to win.
